description: Equipment, Maintenance, PO, and Permissions stories converted from task list to ScopePlayground schema. — Conformed `position` to {effort, rank, value} and removed `id` per Convex validator. — BusinessValue corrections applied to 7 stories.

stories.title: ENHANCEMENT: Admin View of Employee Profiles
stories.userStory: As an admin I want a consolidated admin-only view of employee profiles so I can quickly review status, assignments, and compliance.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin can view any employee's profile with core fields (name, role, company, status).
Admin view displays assigned equipment and latest training/compliance status.
Admin view links to audit log entries related to the employee.
Access restricted to Admin or above.

stories.title: Provide Cost Estimate: Equipment Maintenance/Warranty Service Project
stories.userStory: As a product owner I want a clear cost estimate for the equipment maintenance & warranty service project so that I can scope budget and timeline.
acceptanceCriteria: Estimate broken down by epics (Requests, PO, Provider Portal, Logs, Reports).
Includes points, hours, and lead roles per epic.
Assumptions and out-of-scope explicitly listed.
Delivery risks and dependencies identified.

stories.title: FUW: Leslie to Coordinate Adding Equipment to System
stories.userStory: As a coordinator I want Leslie to work with staff to add equipment so that seed data exists for acceptance testing.
acceptanceCriteria: Initial equipment list imported or entered (min 20 records).
Each item has owner/company, status, and unique asset identifier.
Sample assignments created for at least 3 employees.
Blocker reason recorded and updated when unblocked.

stories.title: Employee Equipment Assignment
stories.userStory: As a company administrator or Equipment Manager I want to assign equipment to employees so that visibility, access, and control follow assignments.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin/Equipment Manager can assign equipment to one or more employees.
Assigned equipment appears in the employee’s dashboard immediately.
Removing assignment revokes visibility and access.
Audit log captures all assignment and removal events.
Employees cannot access equipment not assigned to them.

stories.title: Administrative Geo-Tracking Reports
stories.userStory: As an admin or equipment manager I want geo-history, mileage, and behavior reports so I can audit driving and zone compliance.
acceptanceCriteria: Timeline of GPS locations per equipment.
Calculated vs. actual mileage displayed.
Average speed, max speed, and stop/start events displayed.
System flags mileage discrepancies.
System highlights entries outside approved geo-zones or time ranges.
Filterable by equipment, employee, and time range.
Export to CSV and PDF.
Access restricted to Admin/Equipment Manager.

stories.title: Job Site & Employee-Constrained Equipment Visibility
stories.userStory: As an employee I only want to see and act on equipment and job sites I'm assigned to so that I remain scoped to relevant work.
acceptanceCriteria: Employees see equipment assigned to them or to their job sites only.
Maintenance requests allowed only for accessible equipment.
Comments/updates restricted to assigned equipment/job sites.
No view/modify access to unrelated job sites/equipment.
Permissions enforced in UI and backend.
Blocked attempts are denied and logged.

stories.title: Admin-only Job & Equipment Creation/Assignment Restrictions
stories.userStory: As an admin I want only privileged roles to create, update, delete equipment and job sites so that governance is enforced.
acceptanceCriteria: Only Admin/Equipment Manager can create/update/delete equipment.
Only Admin/Equipment Manager can create/update/delete job sites.
Employees cannot create or modify equipment/job sites.
Unauthorized attempts yield friendly error messages.
All create/update/delete actions logged with timestamp and user.
Role-based permissions enforced across frontend and backend.
Automated tests verify access restrictions.

stories.title: Employee Equipment Work & Maintenance Request Submission
stories.userStory: As an employee I want to submit maintenance requests for my assigned equipment so that issues are tracked and resolved.
acceptanceCriteria: Employees can submit new maintenance requests for assigned equipment.
Mandatory fields: equipment ID, issue description, urgency.
Employee can attach photos or documents to requests.
Submitted requests visible to Admins/Managers immediately.
Employee can track request status (submitted, in review, approved, scheduled, completed).
Employee receives notification when status changes.

stories.title: Admin: Maintenance Request PO Approval & Management
stories.userStory: As an admin I want to triage and approve maintenance requests and generate POs so that work can be scheduled and tracked.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin is notified of new maintenance requests.
Admin can approve, deny, or request more info.
Approved requests generate a unique P.O. number automatically.
Admin can edit P.O. details (vendor, expected cost, due date).
Admin can schedule work (assign vendor or in-house).
Admin can comment on requests for clarification or instructions.
System tracks full history of approvals, denials, edits, and status changes.
Reports by P.O. status (pending, approved, scheduled, completed).

stories.title: Equipment Maintenance Log Review
stories.userStory: As a user I want an immutable chronological maintenance log per equipment so that compliance and history are auditable.
acceptanceCriteria: Each equipment record shows chronological maintenance/work log.
Log entries include date, requestor, issue description, resolution, and linked PO (if any).
Logs are immutable once created.
Users can filter by type (repair, inspection, preventive maintenance).
Users can search by keyword or date range.
Access: Admins, Equipment Managers, and assigned employees.
Export available for compliance reporting.

stories.title: (DEFERRED) Provider P.O. Portal
stories.userStory: As a registered provider I want to view and update my assigned POs so I can fulfill work without accessing unrelated data.
acceptanceCriteria: Providers can log in and view only P.O.s assigned to them.
Providers can update limited status fields (acknowledged, in-progress, completed).
Providers can add comments/questions linked to P.O. history.
Providers can upload documents (invoices, receipts, work orders).
Providers can review payment status (pending, approved, paid).
Providers cannot see P.O.s not assigned to them.
System logs all provider interactions with P.O.s.
Providers receive notifications when P.O. status changes.

stories.title: DECISION: Auto-add Assigned Equipment to Jobsites?
stories.userStory: As a team we need a decision on whether employee-assigned equipment should be auto-added to their jobsite so that visibility rules remain consistent.
acceptanceCriteria: Decision documented with pros/cons.
If 'Yes', rules and automation steps defined.
If 'No', rationale captured and edge-cases addressed.

stories.title: DECISION: Define Equipment Manager Role
stories.userStory: As a team we need clarity whether Equipment Manager is a distinct role so that RBAC can be implemented cleanly.
acceptanceCriteria: Role existence confirmed or rejected.
If confirmed, permissions added to Rights & Roles matrix.
Affected screens and API permissions updated.

stories.title: DECISION: Are Providers Their Own Employee Type?
stories.userStory: As a team we must decide whether providers are modeled as employees or separate entities to simplify permissions and data modeling.
acceptanceCriteria: Data model choice recorded with justification.
RBAC implications documented.
Migration plan (if needed) captured.

stories.title: Equipment Status Field
stories.userStory: As an admin I want equipment to have a status so that lifecycle and availability are clear.
acceptanceCriteria: Status field added (e.g., Active, In Maintenance, Retired).
Status editable by Admin/Equipment Manager.
Filters support status values across lists and reports.

stories.title: Refactor Mileage Tracking to Dedicated Report
stories.userStory: As a developer I want mileage tracking moved from the equipment table into a dedicated report so that performance and history are improved.
acceptanceCriteria: Mileage log exists with date/time and miles entries.
Users can enter mileage into the log (date/time, miles).
Mileage history preserved and queryable (not just sum).
Equipment table no longer stores aggregated mileage directly.

stories.title: Maintenance Intervals & Notifications
stories.userStory: As an Equipment Manager I want maintenance intervals with notifications so preventive maintenance isn't missed.
acceptanceCriteria: Configurable maintenance intervals per equipment (time or usage-based).
Upcoming-due notifications to Admin/Equipment Manager.
Overdue alerts and escalation path defined.

stories.title: GPS Mileage Tracking Identity Strategy
stories.userStory: As a systems architect I want to decide whether mileage is tracked by VIN or device ID so that data integrity is maximized.
acceptanceCriteria: Identity source (VIN or device) selected with rationale.
Mapping rules defined for device swaps and multi-device scenarios.
Backfill/migration approach documented.

stories.title: Employee Access to Equipment Files
stories.userStory: As an employee I want to see files attached to my assigned equipment so that I can access manuals and documentation.
acceptanceCriteria: Employees can view files attached to equipment they are assigned to.
Access controls enforced server-side.
Audit log includes file view events.

stories.title: (DEFERRED) JobNimbus Integration
stories.userStory: As an admin I want a JobNimbus integration so CRM/job data can sync with our system.
acceptanceCriteria: Add ManagerId to Employees.
Add SalesRep to Jobs table.
Add Company Locations table (with hours optional).
Add Lead Source fields where specified.
Rename Employees to Team (or map accordingly).
Add project manager to employee type.
Add address line 2.
Job table updates: JobType, Status, Lead Source, Tags, Type of Loss, Insurance Company, related Contacts, Class (reference JobNimbus), job photo, Date of Loss.
Contact table includes standard info, Contact Type, Status, Sales Rep, Lead Source, assigned to, related contacts.
Field mappings and validation documented.
Sync jobs, contacts, and companies with conflict resolution.

stories.title: Rights & Roles Matrix (Equipment Management Capabilities)
stories.userStory: As a platform owner I want a defined and enforced Rights & Roles matrix so that permissions are consistent.
acceptanceCriteria: Matrix updated to include Equipment Manager capabilities.
Permissions enforced across UI and API endpoints.
Automated tests verify role actions.

stories.title: Update Rights & Roles Matrix & Notify Brent
stories.userStory: As a PM I want the updated matrix communicated so stakeholders are aligned.
acceptanceCriteria: Matrix updated in documentation repo.
Summary sent to Brent with key changes.
Follow-up Q&A captured in notes.

stories.title: P.O. System Core
stories.userStory: As a user I want to create, edit, view, and remove Purchase Orders so procurement can be managed.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can create, edit, view, and remove POs (per role permissions).
Files can be attached to a P.O.
Users are notified of relevant P.O. changes based on access.

stories.title: Comments & Notes (Equipment, Requests, etc.)
stories.userStory: As a user I want threaded comments with notifications so collaboration stays in context.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can reply to a comment (threaded).
Notifications on replies are sent to participants.
Notification deep link opens the relevant entity view.

stories.title: Manage Contacts & Associate as Vendors
stories.userStory: As an admin I want to manage contacts and mark some as vendors so procurement flows can reference them.
acceptanceCriteria: Add new contacts.
Edit existing contact details.
Remove unnecessary contacts.
Associate contacts as vendors.
Contact information verification step available.
